Description: Fragment of Cypriot pottery basket-handled amphora; part of shoulder and neck, with traces of handle roots, five repair holes at edges of sherd; cream slip on outside. Hard, yellow clay, Munsell 5YR 6/6 (reddish yellow); small dark mica, white and dark inclusions.
Curator's comments: For further basket-handled amphorae found at Tell Dafana, cf. Petrie 1888, pl.33, 6. Petrie lists their findspots as rooms 2, 3, 9, 57 and 27. The shape is common from the 7th C BC onwards and found in great numbers in the Levant. Scientific analysis (NAA & Petrographic Analysis) has shown that these vessels were produced in Cyprus and along the North Syrian coastline. (S. Weber)
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 333)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.115, p.225, pl.67)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
